revised_title: A Further Minute Analysis of the Motor Region of the Cortex Cerebri in the Monkey
tldr: This study by Beevor and Horsley examines the motor region of the cortex cerebri in the monkey (Macacus sinicus) through electric stimulation. They focus on the facial area and discover precise localization for movements of individual facial parts, even half of the lower lip. They also discuss the specialization of tongue movements and some degree of unilaterality in soft palate and pharynx movements.
